definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely

sentences.english: I hope Your Most Reverend will take the lead and we shall do our best to follow in this work.
sentences.chinese: 希望大主教能帶頭領導，我們將盡心盡力追隨。

sentences.english: Kinglony 's success depends on talent excellence, dedicated staff.
sentences.chinese: 金隆的成功，有賴才幹卓越，盡心盡力的員工。

sentences.english: It may be said that the teacher has done his very best to educate and help him.
sentences.chinese: 老師對他的教育幫助可謂盡心盡力。

sentences.english: I think that the webmaster makes out already very good.
sentences.chinese: 竊以爲斑竹已經盡心盡力了。

sentences.english: I simply hope to have enough to eat and wear so as to dedicate myself to writing.
sentences.chinese: 我只是希望喫得飽，穿得暖，而盡心盡力地寫文章。

sentences.english: This is a letter Chiang Likang wrote to Chenpang asking him to serve his country with all his efforts.
sentences.chinese: 這封信的主題是姜立綱請求鎮邦能夠爲國家盡心盡力。

sentences.english: As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.
sentences.chinese: 只要你盡心盡力，你就會重新奪得何時你找到了它。

sentences.english: Heart draws to care, to the best of the end for LeiLei was deeply moved.
sentences.chinese: 心平盡心盡力的照料，終令雷蕾深受感動。

sentences.english: Do not compare with others; simply do your best.
sentences.chinese: 不要跟他人比高比低，只要自己盡心盡力。

sentences.english: I am very committed in the fight against racism.
sentences.chinese: 在反對種族歧視的鬥爭中我會絕對盡心盡力。

sentences.english: Words, the best letter, loyalty, and dedicated society. State.
sentences.chinese: 言信一致，盡心盡力，效忠國家，獻身社會。

definition: to spare no pains or effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
variant of 給予|给予[ji3 yu3]
willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
to set an example (idiom); to serve as a model
